title: 111_hr6471
content: The Act is titled the "EMP Weapons Accountability Assessment Act" and requires a report on foreign development of electromagnetic pulse weapons. The Director of National Intelligence must submit a report to congressional committees on foreign countries' EMP weapons programs, including research, development, testing, and deployment. The report should identify countries pursuing EMP weapons programs, their means of delivery, and platforms, as well as estimate when the programs began and their scope. The report to congressional committees on foreign countries' EMP weapons programs includes details such as the scope of the program, technical characteristics of the weapons, program advancement, sources of assistance, and incorporation into national security and military strategies. The report on foreign countries' EMP weapons programs includes details on tests conducted with delivery systems, research on EMP effects, vulnerabilities, and survivability, and testing of EMP delivery systems from platforms. The report on foreign countries' EMP weapons programs includes an assessment of their weapons capability against the United States, perception of vulnerability to an EMP attack, and details of their research and development programs for EMP weapons. The report also includes references to other reports and an unclassified summary, to be submitted to Congress by the Director of National Intelligence. The Director of National Intelligence must submit the first report to the appropriate congressional committees within 180 days of the enactment of this Act. If there is a delay, the Director must notify the committees 30 days before the deadline and provide a new submission date. The term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to specific committees in the House of Representatives and the Senate. A "delivery system" is any method used to place an EMP weapon in a location to cause damage to electrical and information systems. An "electromagnetic pulse weapon" or "EMP weapon" is defined as a weapon that generates an electromagnetic pulse to disrupt infrastructure. An "electromagnetic pulse weapon" or "EMP weapon" is an explosive weapon that generates electromagnetic fields to damage electrical power systems, electronics, and infrastructure. The term "platform" refers to any system capable of launching an EMP weapon delivery system.
